utterance.speaker: JOHN DESSENS
utterance.content: Hey, did you eat my fries?

utterance.speaker: SELENA RIGAS
utterance.content: You shouldn’t have left them.

utterance.speaker: RIGAS
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: DESSENS
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: DESSENS
utterance.content: Call 911!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Almost there, Castle. Just another two weeks.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s already been two weeks. Two weeks is an eternity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, maybe next time we go skiing you’re not going to be such a showoff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t showing off! Okay, I was showing off a little bit, but I swear to you I can do a tail grab with my eyes closed. And without breaking my kneecap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Well, I am off. Now, the retreat is out of cell phone range, so if I don’t call you on your birthday it is not because I have forgotten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I won’t think it’s because you’ve forgotten. I’ll think it’s because you made other plans.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now wait a minute. You and Katherine were supposed to be celebrating in Bora Bora this week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you’re right. Have a great time on your retreat. On your only son’s birthday.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It is a spa trip, darling, not a guilt trip. He’s all yours. See you in a week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon Castle. Stop feeling sorry for yourself. I’ll get us a reservation and I’ll take you somewhere nice for your birthday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As nice as Bora Bora?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! Katherine, your ride is here!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ride?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. We had a body drop. I asked the boys to pick me up so I’d have enough time to make you breakfast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m missing another case? No! C’mon! Take me with you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! Not until you get better.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Castle. How’s the knee?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not the knee so much as the boredom.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought you writers liked being alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, if I could write. But the painkillers make me a little loopy. Last night I used the word ‘speculate’ three times in the same sentence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. You must be bored. You’ve actually gone Rear Window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis got me those as a joke to cheer me up. I have not yet resorted to voyeurism.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then you are missing out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Let me see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, no!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Give me those!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, she was just about to take off her towel.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, the towel’s off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless the body you’re looking at is dead, I suggest you drop those binoculars. Okay, Castle – - I will call you and check on you soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, what if I consult by phone? We could pretend I’m Charlie and you’re my angels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are men such babies when they get sick or injured?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s an evolutionary thing. Men who can get women to take care of them, they have a greater chance of survival.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really, Espo? Where’d you read that? “You’re Making It Up Magazine”?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie. What do we got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Sorry sweetie. It’s a bad one. Multiple contusions to the head, evidence of fracturing at the base of the skull. From the patterning I’d say she was repeatedly struck by that bat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do we know who she is?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The guard that found her ID’d her as Clara DeWinter, 35, lives in Queens, and married.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was she doing in this alleyway in the middle of the night?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She was an IRS agent. Worked in this building here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently she was working late. Employees sometimes cut across the alley to get to the parking garage next door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we have a witness?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but we may have something way better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: RIGAS
utterance.content: No idea, ma’am. Never seen anything like it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s an infrared camera, so our attacker could be wearing some sort of high-intensity IR lights, which would be invisible to the eye but blinding to that camera.

utterance.speaker: DESSENS
utterance.content: That’s pretty sophisticated for a street criminal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, this wasn’t a street crime. The person knew that that camera was there and took precautions. This was a premeditated murder. Wait, go back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right there. That’s our killer’s car. All right, let’s have tech filter that image for make and model and let’s see if they can get us a better look at our attacker’s face.

utterance.speaker: GAVIN DEWINTER
utterance.content: With all the cutbacks her workload increased. She’d stay late a couple times a week trying to catch up. On those nights I’d pick up an extra shift at the store.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: We had dinner around seven, then uh … both went back to work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did she seem? Was she nervous? Upset?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: No. She was fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what exactly did you wife do for the IRS?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: Uh, she was an investigator. She went after tax evaders.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she must have made enemies.

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: Yeah. Pretty much everyone she audited.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was there anyone in particular she had trouble with?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: Uh, actually … yeah. We were out – out at dinner a couple of weeks ago and this guy comes barging into the restaurant, accusing Clara of destroying his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you who he was?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: Just another tax cheat she took down. She said it was no big deal, but I could tell. She was rattled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell me what he looked like?

utterance.speaker: GAVIN
utterance.content: Six feet, dark hair. You should check with her work. She promised to file a complaint, so …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like we’ve got some beautiful clear skies with us today. A nice tailwind is going to get us there right away, folks. We’ll be there … zero dark thirty, zero dark quarter to. Nice, Red-5. You’re looking good. Oh no! I felt something wrong! Ooh, that’s not good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Evade! Evade!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: … survivors?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE BLUNT
utterance.content: Look, most IRS agents get threats. It’s the nature of our business.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did Mrs. DeWinter report any recently?

utterance.speaker: BLUNT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BLUNT
utterance.content: You have to understand. Clara was a rare breed. An IRS agent who actually liked her job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What does that have to do with her being threatened?

utterance.speaker: BLUNT
utterance.content: The thing is, each threat requires an investigation, which is a headache for upstairs. It’s an unwritten rule that agents who report threats don’t fare well in performance reviews.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That unwritten rule may have gotten her killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And since you don’t have a record of the threat, we’re going to have to take a look at her audit files going back at least year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Must be writers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that better be for a sick child.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, to be young and underemployed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, guys. Slow down. All right. Maybe close the blinds. Mmhmm. All right, you kids, you have fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone’s home early.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? You’re going to kiss him now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe next time you’ll think twice about being cheating cheaters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh oh. Someone’s got some ‘splaining to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, guys. So tech couldn’t get us a better look at the attacker’s face, but they’re hoping to have an ID on the car by morning. What’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Clara’s colleagues don’t remember her mentioning any explicit threat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But if we’re looking for people whose lives were ruined there’s no shortage of suspects. We’ve got houses that were repossessed, bank accounts that were seized, businesses that were shut down, and we’re only a couple of months in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s put a list together and pull photos. See if the husband recognizes anyone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m … at work. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said you were bringing home dinner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, on my way home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So when are you leaving?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When soon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like in … half an hour?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He is so on to you. Ah ha, ah ha … here it comes. The inevitable huge breakup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, no, no. Don’t – don’t take the knife. Don’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m not going to get there any faster –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, no! Beckett – Beckett, listen. I think I just saw a murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why aren’t they arresting him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I know what I saw. He took a knife and followed her into the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I looked in the bedroom. Everything was fine. No blood, no body. I swear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you look under the bed? In the closet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, the guy was relaxed and fully cooperative. He let us poke around without a warrant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he probably hid the body. If he was completely calm he could be a psychopath.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did he say about the girl?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He admitted they had a fight, they broke up, and she left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not possible. I would have seen her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So … you were watching the whole time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – … well, not the entire time. I had to –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So … she could have left and you didn’t see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s possible, but –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because he called her. Handed me the phone. I spoke to her. She confirmed his story. She was in the car on the way to her mom’s house in Philadelphia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, thanks guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But you do have a vivid imagination. And you’ve been stuck inside for two weeks. What were you doing looking out the window anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bored? So you saw what you wanted to see? When did you take your last pain killer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was not hallucinating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. You’re here with a broken leg, binoculars, seeing a Rear Window scenario playing across the way. I mean, what are the odds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Astronomical.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. I’m going to make us some dinner and then get you to bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. I can explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, he was pacing back and forth in his apartment and he kept looking towards the bedroom. And then he slept on the couch. Now, why would you sleep on the couch when you have a perfectly good bed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I could ask you the same question.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you why. Because he had a dead body in there. Ryan and Esposito didn’t find it because he hid it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you realize what you’re doing? You’re obsessing over this because you have nothing else to obsess about. Why don’t you just come with me to the precinct, focus on a real murder, instead of wasting your time on an imaginary one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well actually, I was thinking about maybe doing some writing today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, as long as by writing you don’t mean staring out the window ogling at your neighbors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! That would be immoral and intrusive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like you’ve never done that before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. How’s Jimmy Stewart?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, up half the night waiting for the neighbor to move the body. So did tech get anything on our killer’s car in the alley?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they identified it as a late model, light colored CLS-550. I’ve got folks combing over Clara’s audit records to see if anyone lists that vehicle on a return.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so I just got off the phone with security at Clara’s office. A few weeks back this guy tried to muscle his way past security. Now, they tried to detain him but he broke free and he tore out of the parking lot in –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A CLS-550.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This looks like the guy Gavin said was after his wife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, so I compared that photo to Clara’s audit files and I got a hit on this guy. Dan Renner. He’s an anti-government, pro-freedom hot head. Made a fortune on a chain of dry cleaners in Brooklyn that he’s neglected to pay taxes on in nearly a decade and because of Clara’s audit he’s facing criminal charges. His wife just filed for divorced.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like someone has an axe to grind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or a bat to swing. Pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He bought rope and a tarp. Not what would you need a tarp for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s blood. You’re washing away the – – he’s washing away the blood!

utterance.speaker: DAN RENNER
utterance.content: They took my house, my marriage. I was facing a jail sentence. So yeah. I wanted to have a few words with Mrs. DeWinter about the land of the free. That doesn’t mean I killed her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what that is? That’s a silver CLS-500, just like you drive, fleeing her murder scene.

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: Just like the one I drove. Look, my 550 was seized by federal agents two weeks ago. You can check. And give what Mrs. DeWinter was going to do for me, I’m the last person who wanted her dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Going to do for you?

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: Yeah. She came to see me a week ago. Said she needed a favor. And if I helped her, she’d make the criminal charges go away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a favor could she possibly have wanted from you?

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: Because of how I hid my money – fake names, multiple IDs – she asked me to help her disappear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Disappear?

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: Yeah. She said if I helped her get a new identity she’d help me get my life back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would she want a new identity?

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: She didn’t say. But now she’s dead and I’m screwed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Renner, where were you two nights ago at 1:38AM?

utterance.speaker: RENNER
utterance.content: At my sister’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? Castle’s calling. He says it’s an emergency.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is not an emergency!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I caught him red handed. Literally, red handed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so then it’s gotta be blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What else could it be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Red paint? Tomato juice? Beets? Red velvet cupcakes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He bought a tarp and a rope. He brought them into the bedroom where I’m betting right now he’s cutting her into portable pieces. Get a warrant, search that place before there’s no evidence left!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito talked to the girl. We know she’s alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you know it’s the same girl? It’s possible he paid someone to be his alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or it’s possible something else entirely is going on here. Look, I know that you’re lonely and that you miss me. I miss you too. But you don’t have to keep making up things to have me come back here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You think this is a ploy to get you here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I don’t mean to be like –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know what you mean. All right? And I know what I saw.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you know what? I have to get back to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. You really don’t believe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be back later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? Don’t worry about it. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. What was the emergency?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wanted me to get a warrant to search the place across the way. It looks like he’s taking this whole thing pretty seriously.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Should we be worried?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just hope he doesn’t do something stupid. Where are we with Dan Renner?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His alibi checks out. And he was telling the truth about his car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he’s telling the truth about Clara as well. Let’s dig deeper into her life. See if we can find anything. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s getting rid of the body. Beckett’s going to have to believe me now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: If you thought he was getting rid of the body, why didn’t you call Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, because she thinks it’s all in my head. A byproduct of my imagination and pain pills.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Like that time you were convinced my art teacher was a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon! He looked just like the guy from America’s Most Wanted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you ever stop to think that maybe there’s an innocent explanation for everything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, what is the innocent explanation for rolling up a rug and taking it out of your apartment at 3AM?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. That is pretty weird.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? And then he didn’t come back until 4:30 this morning. Where’d he go?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know but he’s up now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh … he, uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? What do you see?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’s taking off his clothes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Give me that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ooh, he’s cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Seriously.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You shouldn’t be watching this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, neither should you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s creepy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Staring at the phone won’t make it ring. I learned that in junior high.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe I should go over there. I mean, his birthday’s tomorrow –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Trust me, he’ll call when he’s ready. And you’re not going to want to miss this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We went through all of Clara’s records. Turns out, she was hiding something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Over half a million dollars in a secret bank account and she used every legal trick to hide it. Nobody, not even her husband knew about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This girl make $75k a year. How did she get her hands on half a mil?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, at first we thought she was shaking down her auditees, but then we traced the deposits.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All from businesses owned or affiliated with Tommy Valentino.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tommy ‘the Shark’ Valentino? Why is an IRS agent taking payoffs from a crime boss?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but wanting to disappear, getting whacked in an alley? It’s all starting to make sense.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s been two hours. What’s he doing in there?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh! Here he comes, here he comes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
